page.title: 09CONTINUED
page.content: The machinery on Damhead consists of four tractors, two balers, one mower, one hay turner, dung spreader, plough, cultivation equipment,trailers and all usual machinery. This is a normal day for Mr.Robson at this time of the year. At 6.30am Mr.Robson cuts silage. Then, at 6.50am, he checks the beasts. He goes down to Cotland (a farm outwith our area) to feed one calf at 7.30am. At 8.00am he has his breakfast which is usually cornflakes, a boiled egg and a cup of tea. Until 12.00pm he cuts silage. By 1.00pm he has finished his dinner. Then he bails the grass he cut the day before. At 8.00pm, Mr.Robson has his tea. Next, he cuts the grass for the next days baling. Mr.Robson finishes his days work at 9.30pm.
